intro: Sphaerostephanos austerus, commonly known as the hardy rockrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, narrow, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sphaerostephanos austerus is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
